title: S3 is files, but not a filesystem
dot:
digraph S3_vs_Filesystem{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];DeepModules[label="Deep Modules
- Narrow interface
- Handles many concerns
- Examples: Unix File API, S3"];ShallowModules[label="Shallow Modules
- Wide interface
- Exposes more complexity
- Examples: YAML, SQL ORMs"]; S3[label="Amazon S3
- Simplified API (2 functions)
- No partial overwrites
- High bandwidth for reads/writes
- No rename/move operation
- Slow file listing"]; Filesystem[label="Traditional Filesystem
- More complex API (5 functions)
- Supports partial overwrites
- Handles fragmentation, permissions, etc."]; Databases[label="Databases
- Rely on partial overwrites
- Not compatible with S3 for large datasets"]; SAP[label="SAP
- Shallow Module
- High integration complexity
- Expensive and often fails"]; DeepModules->S3;ShallowModules->SAP;S3->Databases;Filesystem->Databases; Summary[label="Key Takeaway
- S3 is deep but not a filesystem
- Complexity in cloud APIs vs traditional systems"]; S3->Summary;Filesystem->Summary;}
